text: Memoni is an Indo-Aryan language spoken only by Kathiawari amd Bantva Memons from Kathiawar region of Gujarat, India. Memoni is also spoken in Sindh, Pakistan by Kathiawari memons who migrated to Sindh after partition. Memoni language has influence of Sindhi, Gujarati, and Persian. Some scholars consider Memoni language to be dialect of Sindhi language. == References == Category:Languages of Sindh Category:Indo-Aryan languages
title: Memoni language
